Body: Possible Duplicate:  Disable Display Standby when in Developer Mode missing in Android 2.3  CyanogenMod has this "keep screen on if USB debugging" as a feature in Settings > Applications > Development, but my phone isn't supported by CyanogenMod and so this little life saver is missing.I searched the Market and all I could find is Screen On which only attaches to an application, not USB debugging.Is there a simple, tiny app that does only "keep screen on if USB debugging"?
Title: "keep screen on if USB debugging" application?

history.Text: CyanogenMod has this "keep screen on if USB debugging" as a feature in `Settings > Applications > Development`, but my phone isn't supported by CyanogenMod and so this little life save is missing.I searched the Market and all I could find is [Screen On][1] which only attaches to an application, not USB debugging.Is there a simple, tiny app that does only "keep screen on if USB debugging"?  [1]: https://market.android.com/details?id=gr.androiddev.ScreenOn&feature=search_result
"keep screen on if USB debugging" application?

CyanogenMod has this "keep screen on if USB debugging" as a feature in `Settings > Applications > Development`, but my phone isn't supported by CyanogenMod and so this little life saver is missing.I searched the Market and all I could find is [Screen On][1] which only attaches to an application, not USB debugging.Is there a simple, tiny app that does only "keep screen on if USB debugging"?  [1]: https://market.android.com/details?id=gr.androiddev.ScreenOn&feature=search_result

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Disable Display Standby when in Developer Mode missing in Android 2.3](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/12912/disable-display-standby-when-in-developer-mode-missing-in-android-2-3)  CyanogenMod has this "keep screen on if USB debugging" as a feature in `Settings > Applications > Development`, but my phone isn't supported by CyanogenMod and so this little life saver is missing.I searched the Market and all I could find is [Screen On][1] which only attaches to an application, not USB debugging.Is there a simple, tiny app that does only "keep screen on if USB debugging"?  [1]: https://market.android.com/details?id=gr.androiddev.ScreenOn&feature=search_result
